content.raw:
This is potentially unsafe, but I think running `xhost +` might fix this?

My guess is that this isn’t an issue with the docker image bu with the command line to run on your system \(the scripts in the subt/docker directory setup the XAUTH tokens if they don’t yet exist…

You could try going to `subt/docker` directory, editing the `run.bash` script to change `$(basename $1)` to `$1` and then running ` ./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1`
content.html:
This is potentially unsafe, but I think running xhost + might fix this?

My guess is that this isn’t an issue with the docker image bu with the command line to run on your system (the scripts in the subt/docker directory setup the XAUTH tokens if they don’t yet exist…

You could try going to subt/docker directory, editing the run.bash script to change $(basename $1) to $1 and then running ./run.bash nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed tunnel_circuit_practice.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1
